summary: Email chain from August 13-15, 2019, between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding a planned visit to the MCC to inspect the facility, including the area where Jeffrey Epstein was held and died. The visit involves multiple SDNY prosecutors and DOJ officials, with specific requests to see Epstein's cell and other areas, and instructions to avoid speaking to guards due to ongoing investigations.

persons.name: Chas
persons.context: Requested that the new acting warden join the tour of the MCC.

events.title: MCC Visit Planning
events.description: Email coordination for a visit by SDNY and DOJ officials to the Metropolitan Correctional Center to inspect the 2nd floor psych observation and suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Epstein's cell, which was still cordoned off.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The visit was planned to inspect specific areas of the MCC, including the 2nd floor psych observation and suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Jeffrey Epstein's cell.
Epstein's cell was still cordoned off at the time of the planned visit.
The visitors requested that only MCC legal staff escort them and that they would not speak to any guards present due to ongoing investigations.
The email chain shows coordination between the SDNY and MCC regarding logistics, including screening of visitors and the involvement of the new acting warden.
